Question
========
Two test developers are discussing the usability of a new measurement instrument. A well-known psychometrician overhears several suggestions for improving the instrument.

Which of the following suggestions is least suitable for increasing the reliability of the new measurement instrument?
  
Answerlist
----------
* Removing items with a low item-rest correlation.
* Repeating observations with the same individuals.
* Increasing the number of equivalent items.
* Improving the instructions for administration.


Solution
========
  
Explanation: The reliability of the measurement instrument can be improved by:

Option A: Removing items that have little correlation with the rest of the test.
Option C: Increasing the number of items.
Option D: Ensuring clarity in the instructions for participants.

Option B, however, does not make the measurement instrument itself more reliable.
